channel.title: [RESOLVED - DENIED] Avatars
channel.description:
I understand that we don't have images in our signatures because it would decrease the speed that page loads and would look trashy having large images. However, avatars are much smaller and wouldn't decrease the speed in large amounts.
So yeah, my suggestion is that all users should be allowed to have avatars. It would be a good addition to have.
Feel free to support me or disagree with me, but please supply reasons for why you disagree with me.

item.title: [RESOLVED - DENIED] Avatars
item.dc:creator: @Tom Tom
item.description:
@Tom wrote:

I’ve brought this up with Moparisthebest, and I agree with him when he says it would be administration work the staff don’t need (assuming we were able to allow moderators the correct permission set). There is little desire to change how avatars have worked since forever, and no real reason to do so.

Read full topic

item.dc:creator: @Ambokile Ambokile
item.description:
@Ambokile wrote:

[quote=“Loveandpower, post:116, topic:519140”][quote author=Ambokile link=topic=637600.msg4322746#msg4322746 date=1372424175]

[quote author=Lil_Smok3r link=topic=637600.msg4322226#msg4322226 date=1372360984]
Davidi2, what if we had some system? If the avatar gets 10 “bad image” reports, it automatically gets removed.
[/quote]cause somebody who is liked enough could message 10 fellow mopar friends to falsify a report…exactly what happens when somebody made a new account and instantly got 200 rep.
[/quote]or when i got rep reset cause i dropped some kid like 30 rep using my friends lele
[/quote]I thought it was because you exceeded a certain rep amount o_0
[/quote]It was impossible to exceed 200 rep…?
[/quote]impossible to go above but I heard somebody state a long time ago that if you got repped enough times @ 200 rep it would reset ~^ I don’t know #not a web dev[/quote]Sounds pretty stupid to me, I don’t see how it would work like that at all

Read full topic

item.title: [RESOLVED - DENIED] Avatars
item.dc:creator: @Ambokile Ambokile
item.description:
@Ambokile wrote:

Davidi2:

2. As I said earlier, if you report a post that has a bad [img] in it, that image will show up right in the reported posts screen, making it easy for mods to see and punish, even if the person edited their post. Avatars don’t have this logging system, and they don’t show up in the reported posts screen.

So edit post reports to show the user’s avatar - a very minor edit.

Read full topic

item.title: [RESOLVED - DENIED] Avatars
item.dc:creator: @davidi2 Davidi2
item.description:
@davidi2 wrote:

[quote=“Ambokile, post:103, topic:519140”]I don’t see why there needs to be an approval process. We don’t moderate all posts that contain the [img] tag, we just punish members who abuse the tag - so why don’t we just do the same with avatars?[/quote]A few reasons:

  1. Avatars appear in every post a person has made, not just one. This means if someone does post a bad picture in a post, someone can see it once and then remember not to visit the topic again until it gets removed. If it’s an avatar, you may have to see the picture over and over again depending on how many topics the person has posted in and which ones you view.
  2. As I said earlier, if you report a post that has a bad [img] in it, that image will show up right in the reported posts screen, making it easy for mods to see and punish, even if the person edited their post. Avatars don’t have this logging system, and they don’t show up in the reported posts screen.
  3. Avatars are not time-sensitive like posts are. Moderated posts are annoying because other people can reply to the topic after you without even seeing your reply, but avatars are not like that at all.

[quote=“jme, post:101, topic:519140”]As far as I know all globals can track profile edits so we can see if they are doing stuff from there. unless they changing the image on their host which again they can already come here and do.[/quote]I didn’t think profile edits tracked avatars?

Read full topic
